result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Paul Barnard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a Driver Assessment and Safety plan.

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $1,800.00 fine, DNA surcharge and all other costs, disbursements and fees. 
 If revoked, monies to be taken from prison funds by DOC not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician.
No alcohol.
No driving without a valid driver's license or valid occupational license.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

Provide DNA sample.
The Court advised defendant:  that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.

timeConds.notes: Huber and good time.  Court made provision that HOC allow defendant enough time to and from work, and to work his assigned shift.  Defendant ot provide HOC with is work schedule.
